message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.SI 

The paper deals with geometric deep learning, which involves the intersection of computer vision and machine learning. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also deals with mesh-based geometry representations, which falls under the sub-category of cs.GR (Graphics). The paper proposes a differentiable layer for neural networks, which falls under the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also discusses optimization and end-to-end training, which falls under the sub-categories of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
